lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Chatgpt.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Chatgpt.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
chatgptMoreOOP is a desktop chatbot app designed for task managing. With **simple but effective command on a clear interface** the user can do task management easily.
Ensure you have Java 17 installed on your system. You can verify your Java version by running the following command in your terminal or command prompt:
2. open your terminal and go to the directory where you settle the jar file
3. run the jar file with java17 and javafx components
showing all the task in the tasklist with its index and priority
Adding a todo task to the tasklist, priority can be specified, but it's optional. Priority should be an integer.
Adding a deadline task to the tasklist with a specified date in the form of yyyy-mm-dd, priority can be specified, but it's optional. Priority should be an integer.
> deadline DESCRIPTION by yyyy-mm-dd p PRIORITY
Adding a event task to the tasklist with a starting time and an ending time, priority can be specified, but it's optional. Priority should be an integer.
> event DESCRIPTION from STARTING_TIME to ENDING_TIME p PRIORITY
> event DESCRIPTION from STARTING_TIME to ENDING_TIME
mark an event as done, finding the event by using its index in the list
reset the event as not finished yet
finds tasks that contain the keyword
delete a task through a given index
> update INDEX d DESCRIPTION p PRIORITY

* Main class for a more Object-Oriented version of the Chatgpt task management application.
* This class initializes the necessary components and handles the main execution loop,
* delegating command parsing and execution to specialized classes.
* The main method to run the application.
* It sets up the application by initializing UI, storage, and parsing components,
* and processes user commands continuously until termination.
* @param args Command line arguments passed to the application.
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException If an operation encounters an empty description where one is required.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file necessary for storage operations cannot be found.
public static void main(String[] args) throws EmptyDescriptionException, FileNotFoundException {
TaskList tasks = storage.load();  // Load the existing tasks from storage
Parser parser = new Parser(tasks, storage, ui);  // Initialize the parser with the loaded tasks and UI
ui.showWelcome();  // Display welcome message to the user
String line = ui.readCommand();  // Read user command
parser.parse(line);  // Parse and execute the command
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.

NewParser parser = new NewParser(tasks, storage);  // Initialize the parser with the loaded tasks and UI
return parser.parse(input);  // Parse and execute the command

* This class contains tests for the Deadline class, particularly focusing on the output of the
* toFileFormat method. It verifies that the method returns the correct string format for storing

* This test checks whether the method properly combines the task type, completion status, description,
* and deadline date into a formatted string suitable for file storage.
// Create a new Deadline object with the description "1" and a deadline date of "2019-03-30"
// Call toFileFormat method on the Deadline object and store the result

* Test class for the Todo class in the task management application.
* Focuses on verifying the correct behavior of the toFileFormat method,
* ensuring it produces a string that accurately represents the state of a Todo task for file storage.
* Tests the toFileFormat method of the Todo class to ensure it returns a correctly formatted string.
* This test verifies that the method outputs the string in the format 'T | 0 | description',
* where 'T' indicates a Todo task, '0' indicates the task is not done, and 'description' is the task's description.
// Create a new Todo object with the description "1"
// Call toFileFormat method and capture the output
// Assert that the output matches the expected format
assertEquals("T | 0 | 1", toFileFormat, "The toFileFormat method should return the correct string representation.");
